185528752.review:
Tekken 7 is a fast-paced, highly polished fighting game that continues the legendary series with a focus on intense combat and character depth. The game features a roster of diverse fighters, each with their own unique moves and playstyles, making it accessible to both beginners and experienced players.

The game's visuals are stunning, with detailed character models, smooth animations, and dynamic backgrounds. The addition of the Rage system, which grants powerful abilities when your health is low, adds an exciting layer of strategy to matches. Tekken 7 also boasts a solid online multiplayer experience, with smooth matchmaking and competitive play.

However, Tekken 7 does have some drawbacks. While the gameplay is refined, the single-player content is limited, with a somewhat underwhelming story mode that focuses more on spectacle than depth. Some players may also find the game’s learning curve steep, particularly with advanced techniques and combos.

Tekken 7 is an excellent choice for fans of the fighting game genre, offering fast, rewarding combat and a solid competitive scene.

A must-play for fighting game enthusiasts, though casual players may struggle with its depth. Fun with couch-coop is 100% secured, [b]8.5/10[/b].

Tekken 7 hits harder than a family reunion with all the drama—and it’s just as entertaining. The roster of fighters is massive, each with their own set of moves that’ll make you feel like you’ve stepped into the ring with an anime character on a caffeine binge.

The combat is tight, and each match feels like a battle for the top spot on the podium of "Who Can Get Their Face Kicked in the Fastest." Don’t let the flashy combos fool you; there’s a real strategy here, and you'll need to “tek” your time to master it.

185206595.review:
WSTĘP:

„Tekken 7” to gra, która wjeżdża na twój komputer z takim impetem, jak Heihachi na rodzinne spotkanie – wiadomo, będzie chaos, trochę bólu, ale ostatecznie wszyscy będą zadowoleni. Jeśli zastanawiasz się, czy warto zainwestować w ten tytuł, to powiem krótko: Tak. Wciąga jak walka o ostatni kawałek pizzy – od której oczywiście zależy twój honor!

ROZGRYWKA:

Prawdziwa sztuka walki – ale taka, w której nigdy nie wiesz, czy przeciwnik nie wyciągnie jakiegoś absurdalnego ciosu, jakby trenował z Chuckiem Norrisem. Mechanika jest intuicyjna dla nowicjuszy, ale jednocześnie wystarczająco złożona, żeby weterani mogli się popisać – no, o ile nie zostaną skopani przez znajomego, który losowo klika przyciski i nagle odpala „super ultra combo”.

A fabuła? Cóż, w „Tekkenie” fabuła jest jak sałatka przy burgerze – niby jest, ale wiadomo, po co tu jesteś. Są dramaty rodzinne, są zdrady, a całość wieńczy epickie „mordobicie” w klimacie opery mydlanej na sterydach. To jak „Moda na Sukces”, tylko zamiast pocałunków masz rzuty przez ścianę.

GRAFIKA I DŹWIĘK:

Graficznie? „Tekken 7” wygląda tak dobrze, że na chwilę zapominasz, że to gra, a nie prawdziwa walka. Ciosy, efekty, szczegóły aren – wszystko jest na poziomie „WOW, to jest piękne!”. Każdy raz, kiedy rzucasz kogoś przez podłogę, to ma w sobie coś artystycznego – taka sztuka demolki.

Dźwięk to czysta poezja chaosu. Odgłosy ciosów brzmią tak realistycznie, że niemal czujesz ten ból na własnej skórze (albo własnym kręgosłupie). Ścieżka dźwiękowa dodaje energii, jakbyś przed każdą walką pił podwójne espresso. A kiedy usłyszysz, jak ktoś wrzeszczy po obiciu twarzy, wiesz, że to był dobry cios.

PODSUMOWANIE:

Gra, która dostarcza emocji, adrenaliny i radości z każdego zwycięstwa (a także zdrowej dawki frustracji po przegranej, zwłaszcza jak spadniesz z ringu). To idealny tytuł zarówno dla fanów serii, jak i nowych graczy, którzy chcą poczuć smak rywalizacji. Każdy pojedynek to niezapomniana walka – czasem z przeciwnikiem, czasem z własnymi nerwami.

184849950.review:
"A nostalgic masterpiece"
When I was a kid, I used to sit in front of my PlayStation 1 and play Tekken 3 for hours, either alone or with friends. Tekken 7 has managed to bring those memories back.

The game combines classic fighting action with modern elements without losing its unique charm. The characters are diverse, the fights are intense, and the game is especially fun to play with friends.

Whether as a nostalgic look back or as an introduction to the world of fighting games, Tekken 7 offers an excellent multiplayer experience. Highly recommended!

184840641.review: Great game, but not able to find any match online in UP, India. Played against friends had fun.

184827747.review:
The #1 thing the Tekken series is good at is being COOL AS HELL, but that's mostly it.

Good game but the story is practically nonexistent haha. The story is cliche and unoriginal, and too short to really get invested into anyway. I usually spend lots of hours on a game before I get to finishing the story. For example, I have hundreds, maybe thousands of hours in the Battlefield series, but not even halfway through most of the story modes there. This is almost always the case with me playing video games, even if the game was to take 30 mins to complete. But with Tekken7 it took me very little time in comparison. This might be a good thing because it means the action and fight scenes hooked me in, but it is probably also a bad thing because it shouldn't be such a breeze even on the lowest difficulty. Which brings me to my next point:

The difficulty system is nice, because it really is skill-based; you would have to rely on luck as a complete beginner to complete the story on medium difficulty, however, at the easiest difficulty systems are so utterly dumbed down, just too much in my opinion. Being able to mash the same button for every fight in the story is honestly boring and clearly not much effort was put into that area in particular. That system is also pretty confusing IMO. Medium difficulty on the other hand is completely fine and exactly what you'd expect. But I think it does take some character knowledge to not have to rely on luck for the medium difficult. I completed around half of the story before switching to easiest difficulty simply because I'm very picky when it comes to fighting games - I do not like playing characters I don't like nor think are comfortable/intuitive to play.

For example, the battle as Akuma was quite mundane to me, mostly because I never played the character before, so I had to literally go into the moves list to understand how to pull off various moves in order to not just keep dying. Even then, it only slightly helped because I just hate such an unorthodox system for moves, because it's clunky at first, and requires practice, which is something most new players wouldn't have done yet.

Then there's the other side of things. While some fights were too difficult (on Medium difficulty), other fights were literally just the opponent letting me land the same blow over and over again. This inconsistency in AI difficulty, even on Medium difficulty, made things rather underwhelming. The way some of the AI acted should only happen on a difficulty below the current lowest...

Obviously, there's far more I could cover still. But, despite all the negatives, the animations, the fight scenes, and the overall feel of the game, is what still makes me want to recommend this game to other players.

Am I a Tekken fanboy? Not really. I just don't believe that just because a game is bad that it would necessarily make it unenjoyable. Quite the opposite in fact. In some moments, the game is so bad that it is sometimes genuinely hilarious.

184608222.review:
[h1]★★★☆☆[/h1]
Tekken as a franchise has been a lot of fun with all the extra modes in the games. Especially the solo experience modes that is more a traditional story mode compared to the games base ladder like campaign mode. So it was such a shame finding out that all that Tekken 7 offers for singleplayer players is a short ladder like campaign mode, and survival mode. 

The visual customization in Tekken 7 is nice and wacky, there’s a lot of items that can be applied to all the fighters which as per usual is a lot of fun to see here. 

And… that’s about all I can talk about regarding the game, as the other elements aren’t worth talking about in detail. The combat is still the same as previous Tekken games, so if you liked that feeling then you will be glad to hear it still plays like that. 

The roster has been expanded quite a bit with DLC releases , but I feel like it isn’t really worth the money compared to other fighting games DLC characters, Bandai overpriced their DLCs a bit here. 

There’s a whole new gamemode which is hilariously a bowling game, but in order to play that you need to buy the affiliated DLC…

As such I rate Tekken 7 a 3/5, I like really like fighting games but Tekken 7 was a disappointment with the lack of singleplayer content.

184468088.review:
I have come to the conclusion I do not like fighting games. That said, I have some praise and grief to heap. Moreover, this is probably the best of the batch from around the time.

Praise:
Getting the game resized wasn't too much trouble.
The menu is blessedly minimalist.
The story is coherent.
The soundtrack is good.
I like the stage designs.

Grief:
Why does "the reporter" exist? He isn't used effectively as a narrative device.
Changes in character customization cause the game to hang briefly.
Button controls do not account for anything other than Xbox controllers, and even then it is not very well visualized.

183927922.review:
[h1] Recomendo! Mas... [/h1]

Tekken 7 com certeza é um ótimo jogo! Sem sombra de duvidas! Mas eu tive sorte de não ter pago o preço padrão atual no momento dessa analise.
(Recomendo procurar a versão completa do jogo com desconto)

A gameplay permanece semelhante aos jogos anteriores, mas logicamente com algumas mudanças, sendo novas mecânicas e moveset diferente para alguns personagens, eu mesmo não sou muito fã de quando o cara cai no chão com as pernas pra cima... Mas fora isso, agora tem "ultimates" para os personagens quando você fica com pouca vida, é uma mecânica bem vinda (Embora as vezes eu esqueça que ela existe kkkkkk)

Acho que a coisa que mais me incomoda no jogo mesmo são os gráficos, não sei explicar, mas quando eu via em vídeos o jogo parecia muito feio, jogando ele não chega a ser tão feio, mas ainda acho que o Tekken 6 e TTT2 eram mais bonitos.

Mas caso você encontre a versão completa do jogo por menos de R$100, com certeza [b] recomendo! [/b]
Da pra se divertir muito com os modos disponíveis e até o momento o online ainda tem pessoas jogando, então é bem provável que você não terá problemas encontrando partidas.

Dito isso:
[h2] 8/10 [/h2]
[h3] Ainda não supera o 5 de PS2 >:) [/h3]

183770822.review:
Sou fã de jogo de luta, mas tekken não me cativou de forma alguma, os personagem são tudo feio, tudo duro, nada memorável, parece que fizeram qualquer merda pra terem um roster maior, são tudo genérico; as músicas de fundo durante o pau é estressante, são uns dubstep muito ruim pqp não aguento jogar escutando isso; a maiora dos ataque/combo pra executar tu tem que fazer um ritual satânico; eu n joguei o modo história, tô cagando pra história de jogo de luta; as hitbox são bem merda também, passa por cima da tua cabeça e ainda assim te acerta; único ponto positivo desse jogo é a customização dos personagem.
Respeito quem gosta de tekken, mas na minha opinião um dos piores jogos de luta que eu ja joguei.

183757713.review: A nice game if you want to destroy the gamepad and everything around by the way

183741024.review: It can never be like Tekken 3.

183733165.review: One of the best fighting game!!!!

183732581.review:
뉴비라서 잘 모르는데
왜 폴 이새끼는 주먹 한대만 배때지에 잘 쳐박으면 내가 존나 깔끔하게 쓴 콤보보다 더 센거임?

183720662.review: Tekken halt, was soll ich großartig dazu sagen

183720363.review:
게임 케릭이나, 스킬 등 잘 만들었음.
당시 그래픽도 좋아. 인기가 많았을것같음 굳굳

183704005.review:
Pese a que ya hay Tekken 8... Tekken 7 no se queda atrás c:
Cumple su labor como un juego de Tekken, aunque el online está muriendo lentamente-

183699374.review:
Pozycja grywalna na wieczorne amatorskie posiedzenia.
Zwłaszcza z pełnym DLC w super cenie do dorwania na przełomie 2024/2025 :).
Czy przejdę do 8 części, taa ale najpierw troszku się ponapierniczajmy :).

183673766.review: I love Tekken! I just switched over from PS5 to PC and using a 7900 XTX and this makes it REAL HARD to go back. Quality is great and now I think i'm going to buy Tekken 8.
